Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Remove unused SchemaAttrAttribute usage" (#532) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: This removes duplication about schema information and consolidates it into just OpenXmlElement.RawAttributes. The SchemaAttrAttribute was not being used for anything except tests, which causes unnecessary duplication.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "All strings converted to numbers" (#530) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened issue "All strings converted to numbers" (#530) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

There is an issue reading data from the spreadsheet. All cells are somehow converted to numbers even if they contain text. For example the word "testing" becomes 11. I have used the same code with other excel files but text is returned where appropriate. 

**Information**

.Net Framework 4.7.2
[OpenXmlReadProblem.zip](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/2723115/OpenXmlReadProblem.zip)

**Repro**

Please see the attached windows form application. The Excel file is in the bin path (Deposits.xlsx)

Opened issue "ChartUpdater does not work with Waterfall Charts." (#265) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody: I am trying to update data in waterfall chart in word but chartupdater is unable to do this. ChartUpdater does not exist as ChartPart on the MainDocumentPart of word document but it exists as an ExtendedPart. Have you any ideas how to make this work in chart updater?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Multi-word fonts fail" (#264) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Opened pull request "Added using statement to make compile with command" (#263) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
dotnet build OpenXmlPowerTools.sln

apparently notepad isn't the way to edit this file as it shows everythign changed but I just added 

using System.Diagnostics;

as line 3 or it wouldn't compile for me.
